intro: Verbascum abieticola var. trojanum, commonly known as the Trojan mullein, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its medicinal properties, with historical use in treating respiratory ailments. Its distinctive appearance and hardy nature make it a notable species in alpine flora.
